Dear Rodney John Weaver:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff allegedly hugged and kissed a youth. Staff allegedly sent
youth a picture of his genitals.
Investigation On 8/30/23, I interviewed Complainant 1. No new information was
provided.
There is no video of the allegations.
Youth A was in the facility previously and was discharged on
6/7/23. She then returned to the facility on 7/6/23. This incident is
said to have occurred on two different time frames. The picture of
the genitals is said to have occurred after Youth A’s discharge on
6/7/23 and the kiss occurred on 8/27/23.
Interviews:
On 8/30/23, I interviewed Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
that Staff 1 is a good staff who does a lot of things for the agency.
Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 did kiss Youth A, but in a
“fatherly” manner. Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 did admit
this to him when he talked to Staff 1. Administrator 1 reported that
Staff 1 does not have discipline in his file.
Due to police involvement all interviews were stopped until
September 8, 2023. Police determined they are not pursuing.
All interviews were conducted with DHHS unless otherwise noted.
On 9/25/23, I interviewed Youth A. Youth A reported she has an
“on and off” relationship with the staff that work with her. Youth A
reported it is due to her behaviors. Sometimes she gets along with
staff and sometimes she does not. Youth A reported that Staff 1
would give her side hugs, whisper in her ears when hugging her.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 told her she was pretty and kind
before. Youth A reported that Staff 1 gave her his phone number
2

in June 2023. Youth A reported she texted Staff 1 and asked what
he wanted, and Staff 1 sent her a picture of his genital area. Youth
A reported she thinks it was an internet picture, not his personal
genital area. Youth A reported she does not know her phone
number, or Staff 1’s phone number and does not have the phone
anymore. Youth A reported that was the only contact via text
between Staff 1 and herself. Youth A was asked if she showed
anyone this picture and she stated her sister. Youth A reported
that her sister wouldn’t tell anyone about it though, because her
sister is “loyal” to her. Youth A reported she did not tell anyone
about the text at the facility. Youth A reported that on 8/27/23 she
told Staff 1 that she may be leaving the facility soon and Staff 1
gave her a side hug and then kissed her on the cheek. Youth A
stated it “weirded” her out. Youth A reported that staff are not
allowed to hug but he always hugged her.
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E all reported they have
never seen Staff 1 hug anyone. All reported that staff are not
allowed to hug anyone.
Staff 2 reported she has never seen Staff 1 hug Youth A or show
her special treatment. Staff 1 reported there were times that Youth
A was the only youth on her pod so she might have felt that Staff 1
was giving her special attention because he had to come to every
pod and check on them. Staff 1 reported that Youth A did come to
her and stated the allegations to her. Staff 1 reported that Youth A
told her Staff 1 hugged her and kissed her on the cheek because
he thought she was leaving the facility. Staff 2 reported it is not
common practice to hug youth and to kiss youth.
Staff 1 reported Youth A has been with the agency on and off.
Staff 1 reported that Youth A does has behavioral issues and that
they tend to focus on wanting good shifts, so the staff are to “push
her along” and “keep her happy.” Staff 1 reported he only sees her
medication administration time and at dinner. Staff 1 reported that
this time around in the agency she has not had as many
behavioral issues but in the past she has. Staff 1 reported he gave
Youth A side hugs. Staff 1 reported that when Youth A reported
that she was leaving the facility on 8/27/23, that he was extremely
happy that she was finally leaving that he went to hug her, and
Youth A got up and jumped into him. Staff 1 reported that instead
of a side hug, it became a frontal hug. Staff 1 reported that when
he went to pull away from the hug, his lips brushed up against her
cheek. Staff 1 reported he did not mean to kiss her. It was not
intentional. Staff 1 reported he has never given her his phone
number and never sent pictures to her.
3

Documents:
I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All clearances and trainings
were up to date. Staff 1’s performance evaluation was completed
and no issues were noted.
I reviewed the “Examples of Unprofessional Boundaries” Policy:
Prohibited activities and relationships that are indicative of an
unprofessional relationship include but are not limited to:
• Establishing inappropriate boundaries with residents where
in the boundaries of a staff/resident relationship are blurred
DHHS Worker reported there are no findings in his investigation.
Analysis Administrator 1 reported that Staff 1 did express he kissed Youth
A (in a nonsexual manner). Youth A reported Staff 1 kissed her
and Staff 1 reported he accidently kissed her. This is in violation of
the “Unprofessional Boundaries” policy. It was also noted by Staff
2 and Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D that staff do not
hug youth and that they do not see staff doing this. Staff 1
reported he does hug Youth A. Although this particular behavior is
not outlined as inappropriate, Staff 1 did not display this behavior
to other youth; therefore, having the appearance that there was a
special relationship between Staff 1 and Youth A.
There is no evidence to validate Staff 1 gave youth A his phone
number or sent text pictures to Youth A.
Technical Assistance: Although hugging is not outlined in policy
as something staff cannot do, staff are to use discretion when
using this form of touch. It appears from interviews that hugging is
something that is not common from staff to youth. A training
discussing appropriate boundaries outlining history of youth and
appropriate times to use different touches should be discussed.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
